availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Bell Patrick (Breathitt County, Kentucky, circuit court clerk.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, court clerk. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Prudence H. Haddix Patrick. Father of Mary M. Patrick, Armina C. Patrick, Samuel H. Patrick, James C. Patrick, Amelia Patrick, John E. Patrick, and George Patrick. Circuit court clerk in Breathitt County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Breathitt County in 1850. Clerk in Breathitt County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Breathitt County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a private from May 10, 1863, to June 30, 1863. Reported deserted at Virginia on unknown date.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 18B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 55.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District 1, p. 175A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0111.
